en: The word of Jehovah that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
hmr: Pethuel naupa Joel kuoma LALPA thu hung tlung chu.

en: Hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land. Hath this been in your days, or in the days of your fathers?
hmr: Tarsiehai, hi hi hre unla, hi rama um po pohai, na lo sit ro.Hi in hun lai le in puhai hun laia khawm a um ta hlak am a nih?

en: Tell ye your children of it, and let your children tell their children, and their children another generation.
hmr: Chu chu in nauhai hril unla, in nauhai chun an nauhai hril sienla, an nau nâwksâwnghai chun suon dang hril pei raw hai se.

en: That which the palmer-worm hath left hath the locust eaten; and that which the locust hath left hath the canker-worm eaten; and that which the canker-worm hath left hath the caterpillar eaten.
hmr: Thilngein a fâk mahla po chu khauṭhikṭhiin a fâk a, khâuṭhikṭhiin a fâk mahla po chu thingngein a fâk a; thingngein a fâk mahla po chu tuktulungin a fâk zo a.

en: Awake, ye drunkards, and weep; and wail, all ye drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.
hmr: Inruihai, har unla, ṭap ro; uoin dâwn po pohai, a uoin thlum lei chun khêk rak rak unla, in baua inthawka lâk hmang a ni ta sih a.

en: For a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number; his teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he hath the jaw-teeth of a lioness.
hmr: Hnam hrâttak, tiem sênglo ka rama inthawkin a hung suok ta sih a, a ha chu sakeibaknei ha ang a na, sakeibaknei lientak hapui ang a nei bawk a.

en: He hath laid my vine waste, and barked my fig-tree: he hath made it clean bare, and cast it away; the branches thereof are made white.
hmr: Ka grêp hrui a suksiet a, ka theichang kûng hâwng a khek a, a khek fai vawng a, a peihâwn a; a kâuhai chu a fil vâr vawng a.

en: Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.
hmr: Nunghâkin saiip puon bil a, a ṭhat- lai pasal a sûn angin ṭap rak rak ro.

en: The meal-offering and the drink-offering are cut off from the house of Jehovah; the priests, Jehovah’s ministers, mourn.
hmr: Beiphit inhlân dâm, dâwn ding inhlân dâm chu LALPA ina inthawka sukbo a na, thiempu LALPA rawng- bâwltuhai chu an lungngai a.

en: The field is laid waste, the land mourneth; for the grain is destroyed, the new wine is dried up, the oil languisheth.
hmr: Lo chu suksiet a na, ram chu a lungngai a, bu chu suksiet a na, uoin thar chu a kang a, hriek khawm chu a chau a.

en: Be confounded, O ye husbandmen, wail, O ye vinedressers, for the wheat and for the barley; for the harvest of the field is perished.
hmr: Aw, nangni lo neituhai, inzak unla, nangni grêp hrui enkawltuhai, bupui le buṭei leiin khêk rak rak ro; loa bu sîk ding chu a bohmang ta sih a.

en: The vine is withered, and the fig-tree languisheth; the pomegranate-tree, the palm-tree also, and the apple-tree, even all the trees of the field are withered: for joy is withered away from the sons of men.
hmr: Grêp hrui chu a vuoi a, thei- chang kûng chu a châu a, theibufai kûng dâm, intûm dâm le apple thei kûng dâm, loa thing po pohai khawm chu a ṭuoi tah a; mihriem nauhai laia lâwmna chu a vuoi hmang ta sih a.

en: Gird yourselves with sackcloth, and lament, ye priests; wail, ye ministers of the altar; come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God: for the meal-offering and the drink-offering are withholden from the house of your God.
hmr: Nangni thiempuhai, saiip puon dierkei unla, ṭap ro; nangni mâichâm rawngbâwltuhai, khêk rak rak ro; nangni ka Pathien rawngbâwltuhai, hung unla, saiip puon silin zânkhaw- vârin zâl ro: in Pathien ina inthawk chun beiphit inhlân le dâwn ding inhlân chu khap a ni sih a.

en: Sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the old men and all the inhabitants of the land unto the house of Jehovah your God, and cry unto Jehovah.
hmr: Bu nghei hun inser thieng unla, inkhâwmpui ursûn siem unla, LAL- PA in Pathien ina chun tarsiehai le hi rama chênghai po po chu ṭhuoi khâwm unla, LALPA chu ko ro.

en: Alas for the day! for the day of Jehovah is at hand, and as destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
hmr: Chu ni chu a chung a rik de! LALPA ni chu a hnai ta sih a, Iengkim- thawtheia inthawka bohmangna ang hung tlung a tih.

en: Is not the food cut off before our eyes, yea, joy and gladness from the house of our God?
hmr: Ei mithmua fâk ding sukbo a ni naw am a nih? Anih, ei Pathien ina inthawka hlimna le lâwmna leh?

en: The seeds rot under their clods; the garners are laid desolate, the barns are broken down; for the grain is withered.
hmr: Chihai chu hnuoitlang hnuoia chun a hmawn a; zênghai chu a sieh a, bu inhai chu ṭhiekin a um a, a bu chu a vuoi zo ta sih a.

en: How do the beasts groan! the herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture; yea, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.
hmr: Ranhai chu an inrûm nasa de! Bâwng ruolhai chu an lunginzîng a, hlohna hring hmun an nei naw leiin; anih, berâm ruolhai chu an rêm zo tah a.

en: O Jehovah, to thee do I cry; for the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness, and the flame hath burned all the trees of the field.
hmr: Aw LALPA, ka ko che hi; mei chun thlalêr ram hlohna hmun chu a kâng fai tah a, meichawk chun ram thing po po chu a kâng fai ta sih a.

en: Yea, the beasts of the field pant unto thee; for the water brooks are dried up, and the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
hmr: Anih, ramsahai chu nanga ngaiin an inthuok huom huom a, va- dungtêhai chu a kang intan a, mei chun thlalêr hmun hlohna hmun chu a kâng fai ta sih a.
